camera_ir/optical_element/geometry/geome.documentation:
=== IMAS DATA DICTIONARY ENTRY ===
FULL_PATH: camera_ir/optical_element/geometry/geometry_type
IDS: camera_ir
HIERARCHY_DEPTH: 3
TOTAL_CONTEXT_LEVELS: 4
PARENT_CONTAINER: camera_ir/optical_element/geometry
FIELD_NAME: geometry_type
IS_LEAF_FIELD: True
PATH_COMPONENTS: camera_ir -> optical_element -> geometry -> geometry_type

PRIMARY_DESCRIPTION: Type of geometry used to describe the surface of the detector or aperture (1:'outline', 2:'circular', 3:'rectangle'). In case of 'outline', the surface is described by an outline of point in a local coordinate system defined by a centre and three unit vectors X1, X2, X3. Note that there is some flexibility here and the data provider should choose the most convenient coordinate system for the object, respecting the definitions of (X1,X2,X3) indicated below. In case of 'circular', the surface is a circle defined by its centre, radius, and normal vector oriented towards the plasma X3.  In case of 'rectangle', the surface is a rectangle defined by its centre, widths in the X1 and X2 directions, and normal vector oriented towards the plasma X3.

=== CONTEXTUAL HIERARCHY ===
ROOT_IDS[camera_ir]: Infrared camera for monitoring of Plasma Facing Components
CONTAINER[camera_ir/optical_element]: Set of optical elements
CONTAINER[camera_ir/optical_element/geometry]: Further geometrical description of the element

camera_ir/fibre_bundle/geometry/geometry.documentation:
=== IMAS DATA DICTIONARY ENTRY ===
FULL_PATH: camera_ir/fibre_bundle/geometry/geometry_type
IDS: camera_ir
HIERARCHY_DEPTH: 3
TOTAL_CONTEXT_LEVELS: 4
PARENT_CONTAINER: camera_ir/fibre_bundle/geometry
FIELD_NAME: geometry_type
IS_LEAF_FIELD: True
PATH_COMPONENTS: camera_ir -> fibre_bundle -> geometry -> geometry_type

PRIMARY_DESCRIPTION: Type of geometry used to describe the surface of the detector or aperture (1:'outline', 2:'circular', 3:'rectangle'). In case of 'outline', the surface is described by an outline of point in a local coordinate system defined by a centre and three unit vectors X1, X2, X3. Note that there is some flexibility here and the data provider should choose the most convenient coordinate system for the object, respecting the definitions of (X1,X2,X3) indicated below. In case of 'circular', the surface is a circle defined by its centre, radius, and normal vector oriented towards the plasma X3.  In case of 'rectangle', the surface is a rectangle defined by its centre, widths in the X1 and X2 directions, and normal vector oriented towards the plasma X3.

=== CONTEXTUAL HIERARCHY ===
ROOT_IDS[camera_ir]: Infrared camera for monitoring of Plasma Facing Components
CONTAINER[camera_ir/fibre_bundle]: Description of the fibre bundle
CONTAINER[camera_ir/fibre_bundle/geometry]: Geometry of the fibre bundle entrance
